concise_definition: v. 获得, 买入, 学得, 取得

definitions.explanation_en: To gain possession or control of something, often through effort, purchase, or deliberate action, especially when it is not easily obtained.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过努力、购买或有意识的行为获得某物的占有权或控制权，尤其当该物不易获取时。
definitions.example_en: The company is acquiring a smaller competitor to expand its market share.
definitions.example_cn: 该公司正在收购一家较小的竞争对手，以扩大其市场份额。

definitions.explanation_en: To learn or develop a skill, habit, or quality over time through experience or practice.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过经验或练习逐渐习得某种技能、习惯或品质。
definitions.example_en: She has been acquiring fluency in Spanish through daily conversations with native speakers.
definitions.example_cn: 她通过与母语者每日对话，逐渐掌握了西班牙语的流利表达。

definitions.explanation_en: To obtain something abstract, such as a reputation, habit, or tendency, often unintentionally or as a result of behavior.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指获得某种抽象事物，如声誉、习惯或倾向，通常是无意中因行为所致。
definitions.example_en: His constant lateness is acquiring him a reputation for unreliability.
definitions.example_cn: 他总是迟到，逐渐落得了一个不可靠的名声。

comparison.analysis: “Obtaining” (获得) 是一个更中性、更广泛的词，泛指通过任何方式得到某物，不强调过程或努力。而 “acquiring” 更常暗示一个主动、有目的、有时需要付出代价或长期努力的过程，尤其用于技能、资产或复杂事物的获取。
“Gaining” (获得) 常用于抽象事物如优势、信任、体重等，语气较温和，强调结果的增加。而 “acquiring” 更正式，常用于法律、商业或技术语境，强调从无到有的占有或习得，带有更强的主动性。
“Purchasing” (购买) 专指通过金钱交易获得物品，范围狭窄。而 “acquiring” 包含购买，但更广泛，可涵盖继承、学习、赢得、接收等多种方式，是更上位的概念。
